meanings.definition: A person who talks rapidly and incessantly.
meanings.sent1: The gabbler in our class never stops talking.
meanings.sent2: My aunt is a gabbler; she can talk for hours without pause.
meanings.sent3: The little gabbler entertained us with stories all afternoon.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed like a river, a true gabbler in action.
meanings.sent5: The gabbler's voice filled the room, drowning out all other sounds.

meanings.sent1: I tend to gabbler when I get nervous.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, he would gabbler on about his weekend plans.
meanings.sent3: The parrot seemed to gabbler non-stop, mimicking everyone around.
meanings.sent4: Her mind gabblered on, jumping from one topic to the next.
meanings.sent5: The radio host gabblered through the news, barely taking a breath.
